Milton Road Library may move into new development.
Official opening of Newhaven Library (opened in March).
All libraries except Hereford (Central) to be passed to volunteers or closed. Bromyard, Kington and Ledbury to have fully self service libraries. (at least 3 under threat)
Camden – West Hampstead Library may move into new development to save it from closure.

5 libraries to be taken out from council control: Breck Road and Dovecot libraries to be managed by Alt Valley Community Trust (AVCT); Fazakerley Library is to be managed by Fazakerley Federation; Kensington Library will be taken on by Kensington Fields Community Association and others; Walton Library to be run by Mersey Care. 2 others (Sefton Park and West Derby) fate to be decided.
Donald Hope Library £1.2m upgrade, paid for by development. Temporary library for site for  2 years while work takes place.
All five libraries to be closed on Wednesdays, 4 libraries lose 12 hours opening per week, Huyton loses 15 hours.
Tourist Information Centre closed at the Library of Birmingham.
Central Library planned to move to Armada Way

Stafford Library moving to new building in Staffordshire Place, expected to be open in September. Additions will include "digital touch tables", innovation suite (including 3D printers and Raspberry Pi’s)
Fife – Consultation on closing libraries extended to December due to legal advice.
Sandwell – £400k bookfund (plus £80k for non-book materials) – this is an increase of £6k on previous year.
East Sussex – Official opening of Newhaven Library (opened in March).

Liverpool – 5 libraries to be taken out from council control: Breck Road and Dovecot libraries to be managed by Alt Valley Community Trust (AVCT); Fazakerley Library is to be managed by Fazakerley Federation; Kensington Library will be taken on by Kensington Fields Community Association and others; Walton Library to be run by Mersey Care. 2 others (Sefton Park and West Derby) fate to be decided.
Rotherham – Dolly Parton Imagination Library to be stopped (£400k p.a.)
Staffordshire – £625k bookfund stays the same this year.
Walsall – £580k bookfund stays the same this year.
Wolverhampton – £100k cut to bookfund (from £223k the year before). This is in addition to £500k cut (from £1.7m) planned for next five years.

Cuts-hit Birmingham libraries ask public to donate books – Guardian. "In 2013, Birmingham opened the £188.8m Library of Birmingham to the public, saying it would "attract over three million visitors a year", "transform the city’s library service", and "become a major cultural destination".
Knowsley – All five libraries to be closed on Wednesdays, 4 libraries lose 12 hours opening per week, Huyton loses 15 hours.
Herefordshire – All libraries except Hereford (Central) to be passed to volunteers or closed. Bromyard, Kington and Ledbury to have fully self service libraries. (at least 3 under threat)
Merton – Donald Hope Library £1.2m upgrade, paid for by development. Temporary library for site for  2 years while work takes place.
Swansea – Central Library may change location.
Southampton – Confirmed Burgess Road, Cobbett Road, Millbrook, Thornhill and Weston libraries will either be passed to volunteers or closed. Mobile also under threat.
Nottinghamshire – £300k improvements to Arnold Library completed inc. new books, gift shop, café and study section.
Birmingham – Tourist Information Centre closed at the Library of Birmingham.
Plymouth – Central Library planned to move to Armada Way

Staffordshire – Stafford Library moving to new building in Staffordshire Place, expected to be open in September. Additions will include "digital touch tables", innovation suite (including 3D printers and Raspberry Pi’s)
Cambridgeshire – Milton Road Library may move into new development.
Croydon – 2.5 FTE staff to be lost.
Angus – Considering removal of overdue library book fees (£18k per year income).
Blackpool – Consultation next year may include some cuts
Nottinghamshire – £300k improvements to Arnold Library completed inc. new books, gift shop, café and study section.
Suffolk – Literacy ambassador employed after £30k foundation grant. Ballet screenings start of new "Suffolk Libraries Presents" programme.
Southampton – Confirmed Burgess Road, Cobbett Road, Millbrook, Thornhill and Weston libraries will either be passed to volunteers or closed. Mobile also under threat.
Leicester – Proposed cuts: £600k with 20 posts lost and "regrading" for all staff, with pay reductions of e.g £5k for senior library assistants.
Brighton and Hove – 2 libraries to allow access while unstaffed outside of normal hours.
Devon – Ashburton Library moves into post office, extends hours.
North East Lincolnshire – Scartho library to be run by volunteers from September.
Southend – Thorpedene and Friars libraries replaced by Shoeburyness Library.
